question: Is it possible to setup voice prompt? If yes, how to do that in Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones?
ground_truth: Yes, it is possible. To set up the voice prompts you require the Smart Control App (>18). In the app settings, you can activate voice prompts and sound signals (also the default setting) or deactivate them.
answer: To set up voice prompts in the Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones, you need to use the Smart Control app. Within the app settings, you can activate or deactivate voice prompts and sound signals.

ACCENTUM  |  19
Switching the headphones off
▷ Press the main button for 3 seconds.
You hear a sound signal. The LED flashes red 3x. The headphones 
switch off.
Make sure that Bluetooth is already activated on your Blue-
tooth device when switching on the headphones.
If Bluetooth is activated and the headphones cannot find a 
paired Bluetooth device within a few minutes, you hear the 
voice prompt “No connection”. The LED flashes red 3x. The

settings are active even without using the Smart Control app, i.e. 
when you are using a different Bluetooth device.
Setting the voice prompts/sound signals
To be able to set the voice prompts and sound signals, you require 
the Smart Control app (> 18).
In the app settings, you can activate voice prompts and sound sig-
nals (default setting) or deactivate them completely.

question: When do I replace the ear pads and where can I find the replacement ear pads for Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones?
ground_truth: There is no specific timeframe for ear pad replacement. For hygiene reasons, you should replace your ear pads from time to time. Replacement ear pads are available at www.sennheiser-hearing.com/accentum-wireless.
answer: You should replace the ear pads of the Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones from time to time for hygiene reasons. Replacement ear pads can be found at [location not specified].
contexts:

Care and maintenance
▷ Clean the parts of the product only with a soft, dry cloth.
To clean the charging socket:
▷ Blow vigorously over the charging socket. 
▷ If necessary, carefully remove any stuck dirt from the charging 
socket using a dry, soft brush or a dry interdental brush. Only 
apply gentle pressure when doing so.

question: What is the charging time of the rechargeable battery in Momentum 4 Wireless Around Ear Headphones?
ground_truth: Approximately 2 hours
answer: The charging time of the rechargeable battery in Momentum 4 Wireless Around Ear Headphones is approximately 2 hours.

Using the headphones
Information on the rechargeable battery 
and the charging process
The headphones have a built-in rechargeable battery. A complete 
charging cycle takes approx. 2 hours. The charging time can vary 
depending on the power source used and the ambient temperature. 
Before using the headphones for the first time, charge the recharge-
able battery for a complete charging cycle without interruption.

question: How many audio sources can I connect at the same time to the BTT100 Audio transmitter?
ground_truth: You can simultaneously connect 2 different sources to the transmitter.
answer: You can connect 2 audio sources simultaneously to the BTT100 Audio transmitter.
contexts:

Connection to an audio source using the 3.5 mm analog audio cable

to the headphone socket. Check in the menu of your TV to see if the muting 
function can be deactivated. 
 X Connect the 3.5 mm plug of the analog audio cable to the Analog input 
of the transmitter. 
 X Connect the other end of the analog audio cable to the 3.5 mm 
headphone socket of the TV or PC.

X Avoid using mounting parts made of metal, as this can decrease the 
transmitter’s range. 
 X Do not place the transmitter close to metal objects such as shelf bars, 
reinforced concrete walls, etc. as this can decrease the transmitter’s 
range.

question: What happens to the LED light colour when I switch the transmitter on and how do I know whether a connection is established in BTT100 Bluetooth Audio Transmitter?
ground_truth: The LED lights up red when the transmitter is switched on and once the connection is established, the LED lights up blue.
answer: When you switch the transmitter on in the BTT100 Bluetooth Audio Transmitter, the LED initially lights up red. Once the connection is established, the LED changes to blue, indicating that the connection is successful.

The LED lights up red. Once the connection is established, the LED 
lights up blue.

Troubleshooting
Leaving the Bluetooth transmission range
Wireless streaming is only possible in the Bluetooth transmission range 
of your Bluetooth devices. The transmission range largely depends on 
environmental conditions such as wall thickness, wall composition etc. 
With a free line of sight, the transmission range of most Bluetooth devices 
is up to 30 meters.

question: What does 'Podcast' voice prompt mean in Momentum Sport?
ground_truth: Equalizer preset for podcasts is activated (improved speech intelligibility).
answer: I don't know.
contexts:
Product overview
14 | MOMENTUM Sport
Notes on voice prompts
The earbuds output voice prompts for events (the table gives some 
examples). Using the Smart Control app, you can choose between 
voice prompts and beep sounds, or deactivate the status messages 
with a few exceptions (e.g. rechargeable battery is empty). 
Voice prompt Meaning
“Power on” Earbuds are switched on.
“Power off” Earbuds switch off.
“Connected” Earbuds are connected via Blue-
tooth.

“MOMENTUM Sport”. If necessary, enter the default pin code 
“0000”.
If pairing was successful, you hear the voice prompt “Pairing suc-
cessful” and the LEDs of the earbuds flash blue 3x.
If you have completely deactivated the control functions for 
Touch and Tap control via the Smart Control app (see 
page > 53):
• The earbuds can only be controlled via the Smart Control 
app and the connected Bluetooth device. 
• If the earbuds are inserted into the ears (proximity sensors

Using the earbuds
MOMENTUM Sport  | 37
Adjusting the volume
To increase the volume:
▷ Press and hold the control panel of the right earbud until the 
volume is increased. 
To reduce the volume:
▷ Press and hold the control panel of the left earbud until the 
volume is reduced. 
When the maximum or minimum volu me is reached, you hear the
voice prompt “Volume max” or “Volume min”.
WARNING
Danger due to high volume levels!
Listening at high volume levels can lead to permanent 
hearing defects.

question: What should you do to reset MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 earbuds to factory settings?
ground_truth: To reset, disconnect all Bluetooth connections, place one earbud in the charging case, and hold the touch panel of the other earbud for 15 seconds.
answer: To reset MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 earbuds to factory settings, you can use the Smart Control app or manually reset them.
contexts:
FAQ/If a problem occurs ...
MOMENTUM True Wireless 4  | 45
FAQ/If a problem occurs ...
If a problem has occurred, proceed in the following order until the 
problem is solved and you can use the earbuds again:
1. Insert the earbuds into the char ging case and close the lid. Wait
for at least 10 seconds (> 46). 
2. Connect the earbuds to the Smart Control app to install the latest
firmware (> 44).
3. Reset the earbuds to the factory default settings (> 47).

firmware (> 44).
3. Reset the earbuds to the factory default settings (> 47).

FAQ/If a problem occurs ...
MOMENTUM True Wireless 4  | 47
Resetting the earbuds to the factory default settings
If the function of the earbuds is disturbed and a reset (> 46) does not 
improve, reset the earbuds to the factory default settings. This 
deletes, among other things, all pairing settings.
The easiest way to reset the earbuds to the factory default settings 
is using the Smart Control app.
Alternatively, you can manually proceed as follows:

question: In the scenario 1 in Network whitepaper what is the only component needing active configuration?
ground_truth: The only component needing active configuration is the SRV-record in the DNS-Server
answer: The only component needing active configuration in Scenario 1 of the Network whitepaper is the SRV-record in the DNS-Server.
contexts: Scenarios for network integration Scenario 1 - One port solution  In this scenario, all components (MobileConnect Station, MobileConnect Manager, MobileConnect App clients) are part of the same network. One port solution

question: Why does the first ruleset disallow all access using IPv6?
ground_truth: Because MobileConnect Manager is currently only supporting IPv4
answer: The first ruleset disallows all access using IPv6 because the MobileConnect Manager currently only supports IPv4.
contexts: Additionally, connecting a device to a network without internet access limits its usability for other functions, making the system less inclusive.

expect a global configuration file to be located at /etc/mcm-iptables.conf. An example file:            Please note that not every option is used in every ruleset. The first ruleset disallows all access using IPv6, as the MobileConnect Manager is currently only supporting IPv4. Using this ruleset is recommended.

In this case, the ﬁrst WSM being registered in the network owns all access rights. In order 
to avoid any collisions, you should deactivate access to the devices for all other WSMs (see 
Withdrawing access rights from a WSM
).
If you should assign “Exclusive” access right to several WSMs, then access is 
random. The WSM which registers quicker with the device owns all access rights. 
This can, under certain circumstances, lead to confusion during operation.

question: What are the two modes of operation for MobileConnect, and how do they differ?
ground_truth: The two modes are Standalone Mode and Manager Mode. Standalone Mode is easier to set up with minimal IT support, focusing on audio streaming via QR codes without internet connectivity. Manager Mode offers full functionality with IT infrastructure, DNS setup, and centralized administration.
answer: The two modes of operation for MobileConnect are Manager Mode and Standalone Mode. Manager Mode allows for more advanced settings and network configurations, while Standalone Mode focuses on central audio streaming with simplified setup and basic IT support.
contexts:
3 
MobileConnect – System Modes 
 
System  Sennheiser MobileConnect allows streaming live audio content with low latency and in superior quality via WiFi to connected Android and iOS smart devices. To ensure low latency and superior audio quality, unicast is used for streaming.  Application Modes  To adapt to different application scenarios and network environments, MobileConnect can be operated in two Modes: Manager Mode and Standalone Mode.  Mode Differentiation

With Standalone Mode, MobileConnect focuses on its central audio streaming function. After connecting it to a network infrastructure, it is ready to operate. Setup and installation effort are simplified in this mode, only basic IT support is required. All settings and administration are done via the Local Admin Interface. To connect to streams, users have to scan the QR-Code created in the Local Admin Interface.

Wi-Fi  
MobileConnect relies on Wi-Fi to transmit streams to connected smartphones. The quality of the Wi-Fi is directly influencing the service’s quality and performance.   
Quality of Service is recommended.  Usage of 5 GHz band is recommended.  The recommended limit of number of clients per AP is 50.  
 
The term Standalone Mode refers to the MobileConnect Station, not the network infrastructure. MobileConnect does not handle network organization.

question: What is required for using MobileConnect in Standalone Mode?
ground_truth: An enterprise-grade router, access point(s), and a local network with DHCP enabled are required. Streams are accessed using QR codes.
answer: In Standalone Mode, MobileConnect requires connection to a network infrastructure and basic IT support for setup. All settings and administration are done via the Local Admin Interface, and users need to scan the QR-Code created in the interface to connect to streams. No internet connection is required for using MobileConnect in Standalone Mode.
contexts: With Standalone Mode, MobileConnect focuses on its central audio streaming function. After connecting it to a network infrastructure, it is ready to operate. Setup and installation effort are simplified in this mode, only basic IT support is required. All settings and administration are done via the Local Admin Interface. To connect to streams, users have to scan the QR-Code created in the Local Admin Interface.

In this mode, the MobileConnect Station and MobileConnect App are the system components.   Considerations  
ü Ease of installation ü Limited IT support required – Manager functionalities not available – Streams can only be accessed via QR-Code   
Setup Overview  Setting up MobileConnect in Standalone Mode requires the following steps: 
 The target application for Standalone Mode is the equipment of a single room (or multiple single rooms) with live audio streams.

Does the system require an internet connection?
Â¶


The MobileConnect system itself only requires internet connectivity when it is used in the so called âManager Modeâ because the MobileConnect Manager handles the authentication and updates over the cloud.


In âStandalone Modeâ the MobileConnect system does not require an internet connection.

question: How does MobileConnect handle data load per client in Standalone Mode?
ground_truth: The data load is 165 kbps per unique client connection.
answer: The data load per unique client connection in Standalone Mode is 165 kbps.

The term Standalone Mode refers to the MobileConnect Station, not the network infrastructure. MobileConnect does not handle network organization.

With Standalone Mode, MobileConnect focuses on its central audio streaming function. After connecting it to a network infrastructure, it is ready to operate. Setup and installation effort are simplified in this mode, only basic IT support is required. All settings and administration are done via the Local Admin Interface. To connect to streams, users have to scan the QR-Code created in the Local Admin Interface.

question: What network recommendation is critical for using MobileConnect?
ground_truth: The use of the 5 GHz Wi-Fi band is recommended for better performance and reduced interference.
answer: The critical network recommendation for using MobileConnect is to ensure Quality of Service, use the 5 GHz band, and limit the number of clients per Access Point to 50. It is also highly recommended to use the existing Wi-Fi network for MobileConnect to avoid interference and maintain service quality.
contexts:
Wi-Fi  
MobileConnect relies on Wi-Fi to transmit streams to connected smartphones. The quality of the Wi-Fi is directly influencing the service’s quality and performance.   
Quality of Service is recommended.  Usage of 5 GHz band is recommended.  The recommended limit of number of clients per AP is 50.  
 
The term Standalone Mode refers to the MobileConnect Station, not the network infrastructure. MobileConnect does not handle network organization.

If a Wi-Fi network is existing, it is highly recommended to use the same network for MobileConnect. Adding an additional Wi-Fi network will likely cause interference and lower the quality of service. Additionally, usage of a separate network worsens user experiences because it forces users to decide between MobileConnect and the other network’s functionality.  Quality of Service is recommended.  Usage of 5 GHz band is recommended.  It is recommended to make 12 Mbps the lowest mandatory data
MobileConnect relies on Wi-Fi to transmit streams to connected smartphones. The quality of the Wi-Fi is directly influencing the quality and performance of service.

question: What is the recommended Wi-Fi configuration for optimal performance of MobileConnect?
ground_truth: It is recommended to use the 5 GHz band with a Quality of Service configuration. Each access point should ideally support a maximum of 50 clients, with a minimum data rate of 12 Mbps.
answer: The recommended Wi-Fi configuration for optimal performance of MobileConnect includes using Quality of Service, utilizing the 5 GHz band, and limiting the number of clients per access point to 50. It is also recommended to use the same existing Wi-Fi network for MobileConnect to avoid interference and ensure a better user experience.

Smart Control “Sennheiser Smart Control”
You can connect the earbuds to two Bluetooth devices at the 
same time, e.g. to a sports watch and your smartphone with a 
fitness app or to an indoor fitness bike and a sports watch.
3s
LR
 “Pairing“

operating system (see page > 28)
Paired devices establish a Bluet ooth wireless connection immedi-
ately after switch-on and are ready for use.
When switched on, the earbuds will automatically try to connect to 
the last two Bluetooth devices used. The earbuds can save the con-
nection profiles of up to six Bluetooth devices with which they have 
been paired. Audio playback is only possible from one device at a 
time.
If you pair the earbuds with the seventh Bluetooth device, the con-

Getting started
MOMENTUM True Wireless 4  | 15
5. Connecting additional Bluetooth devices
▷ If desired, connect the earbuds to additional devices via Blue-
tooth (> 22).
The earbuds can save the connection profiles of up to six Bluetooth 
devices with which they have been paired. Audio playback is only 
possible from one device at a time.
Using the Smart Control app (“Connections”), you can view the list of 
paired devices and selectively connect and disconnect devices (> 
23).

ground_truth: I don't know
